edu.wmich.cs3310.MPeter.hw5

Class QuickSort

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.wmich.cs3310.MPeter.hw5.QuickSort

  • public class QuickSort
extends java.lang.Object
    This class contains methods that sort a binary file using quicksort by records (4 bytes) and quicksort by blocks (4096 bytes) and generates statistics from the sorting processes.
    Author:
    Matthew Peter

      private int recordsWritten

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      QuickSort(java.io.RandomAccessFile f, int n, int s)
      This constructor assigns passed values to attributes and assigns values to bufferPoolLRU array.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      private void getBlock(java.io.RandomAccessFile f, int blockNum)
      This method reads the requested block of data from the binary file and stores it in an array.
      void getReadsWrites(java.io.FileWriter fw, java.lang.String type)
      This method writes the statistics collected from sorting the binary files to a text file.
      void quickSortBlocks(java.io.RandomAccessFile f, int first, int last, int level)
      This method quicksorts a binary file of records by accessing blocks of records (4096 bytes each).
      void quickSortRecords(java.io.RandomAccessFile f, int first, int last)
      This method quicksorts a binary file of records by accessing only the individual records (4 bytes each).

    • Constructor Detail

      • QuickSort

        public QuickSort(java.io.RandomAccessFile f,
                 int n,
                 int s)
          throws java.io.IOException
        This constructor assigns passed values to attributes and assigns values to bufferPoolLRU array.
        Parameters:
        f - RandomAccessFile object being used to access binary files
        n - Number of records in file
        s - Number of buffers in buffer pool
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - Handles Input/Output Exceptions

    • Method Detail

      • quickSortRecords

        public void quickSortRecords(java.io.RandomAccessFile f,
                             int first,
                             int last)
                      throws java.io.IOException
        This method quicksorts a binary file of records by accessing only the individual records (4 bytes each).
        Parameters:
        f - RandomAccessFile object being used to access binary files
        first - Position of first record in section being sorted
        last - Position of last record in section being sorted
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - Handles Input/Output Exceptions

      • quickSortBlocks

        public void quickSortBlocks(java.io.RandomAccessFile f,
                            int first,
                            int last,
                            int level)
                     throws java.io.IOException
        This method quicksorts a binary file of records by accessing blocks of records (4096 bytes each).
        Parameters:
        f - RandomAccessFile object being used to access binary files
        first - Position of first record in section being sorted
        last - Position of last record in section being sorted
        level - Tracks when the block should be written back to the binary file
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - Handles Input/Output Exceptions

      • getBlock

        private void getBlock(java.io.RandomAccessFile f,
                      int blockNum)
               throws java.io.IOException
        This method reads the requested block of data from the binary file and stores it in an array. If a block is already in the buffer pool, it is not read again. Otherwise, it is read into the buffer pool and data already in the buffer pool is removed if necessary.
        Parameters:
        f - RandomAccessFile object being used to access binary files
        blockNum - Number associated with block being requested
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - Handles Input/Output Exceptions

      • getReadsWrites

        public void getReadsWrites(java.io.FileWriter fw,
                           java.lang.String type)
                    throws java.io.IOException
        This method writes the statistics collected from sorting the binary files to a text file.
        Parameters:
        fw - RandomAccessFile object being used to access binary files
        type - Specifies the data that should be written depending on what type of sorting was done
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - Handles Input/Output Exceptions
